oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Rep. Walter P. Brownlow re: a pension claim
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written in 1898 to an unknown Union pension claimant, seven-term Congressman Walter Preston Brownlow is promising to attend to claimant's application. Rep. Brownlow was a nephew of Tennessee's radical post-Civil War governor, William G. "Parson" Brownlow and is remembered for obtaining large federal appropriations for Tennessee's first congressional district, which included the only Union veterans home in Tenn., in Johnson City.
